comments.commentBody: Trump never killed anyone, so your analogy makes no sense. Why argue in fantasy when there is plenty of reality at hand?

Ted Bundy, a serial killer and necrophile who murdered scores of women, got some woman to marry him while he was on death row. I believe that she was not the only woman who sought to be his bride. This is what comes to mind when I think of all of those who are in Donald Trump's thrall. Regardless of the revelations, his devotees remain true to this boorish liar who promises to cut a swath of destruction in our body politic analogous to that cut in the lives of those unfortunate young victims of Ted Bundy.
Ban products like ROUNDUP and the rates are certain to drop.

Some years ago an analysis found that kids from upscale suburbs were more likely to get brain cancer. It was thought at the time that all the chemicals needed to maintain the huge swaths of perfect lawns was the cause. I don't know what the science was worth because brain cancer in children is very uncommon.

Still it might be interesting to find out if groups exposed to turf chemicals might have higher ALS or cancer rates. Are golfers at higher risk?
I hope people call "Trumpty Dumpty" and laugh out loud at Trumpty rallies.

These proposals are misogyny cloaked in liberalism. There is no truth to the oft-repeated assertion that transwomen have “female brains.” Reputable neurologists have repeatedly shown that there is nothing “female” about the brain of a transwoman. Yes, the brain is very plastic, and, with enough female hormones and obsession over appearance, certain parts of the brain may modify in response, but these are changes that result from hormones and brain activity, not inherent differences.
I know teenage girls who won’t dress out for gym because male students have been given access to their locker room. They refuse to undress next to a person they have known as a creepy male for years. Sex-segregated sports are segregated for objective physical reasons. Female bodies develop very different from male bodies, so all-female sports give females a chance to participate in athletics safely and on a level playing field. Introducing males to female teams means that many females will not have opportunities to participate.
I do not blame the youngsters for this mess. I blame the adults who tell children that stereotypes are hard-wired and that a boy who likes clothes and dolls is “really a female” and a girl who is indifferent to clothes and dolls is “really a male.” That is nonsense and we know it. Like other mammals and many other living species, we are sexually dimorphic. We should celebrate children who reject stereotypes, not teach them nonsense about being born in the wrong body.

I only read the first ten comments, but the mood seems to be hostile. (Cough!)
I'm out of my league on this one.
I believe I had better read the article; this was not what I expected.
I suppose that makes me Biased ... Too.

The obvious solution is to make single-stall bathrooms available wherever there may be a need for anyone who is not comfortable using the bathroom restricted to their biological sex (for whatever reason, not just trans).
However, this has been rejected by the activists and this is the point of this letter. Part of the trans mental illness is insisting that everyone else participate in the delusion and pretend that they are something they are not, and this letter codifies that into law by insisting that it isn't enough to have a safe, comfortable place to void, everyone else must witness you doing so.

What we are witnessing now is the result of generations that were raised by parents that submitted to every demand and tantrum. Education, integrity, and critical thinking, are being undermined by the few that want their way or the highway. And since lack of character is common as well, it is easier to submit than to be subject to expensive lawsuits. Moreover, perhaps this demand to have access based on self-gender identity is another way to undermine the many rights women fought for by dismantling that last safe space available to them: the public bathroom.

Has the administration considered at all that this will also end up requiring male students who identify as female to room with female students? Disney movies aside, that doesn't work out well especially on high school trips. I'm curious how the administration continues to ignore medical authorities such as Johns Hopkins and the College of Pediatricians who both say nothing is changed by these measures and great harm can be inflicted. Indeed Johns Hopkins no longer does gender reassignment surgery because no real improvement in psychological state was noted. The College of Pediatricians have called the imposition of the idea of transgenderism on young children child abuse. Most children go through a neutral period until puberty. Yet we have the same folks who are helicopter parents jumping in to claim their son is a girl just because he likes to wear his big sister's tap shoes. As a teacher I won't be able to take highs school students on overnight competitions out of town for fear that I would have to put a male self identifying as female (without even a medical certificate as to status)in a room with actual females. Does our Federal government stop to think of the consequences down the line?

its like a lot of people have said. that people have been doing it for a long time and no one would have know.  its the fact that you will have perverts and child molesters that's going to use this law to their advantage, that's why I don't believe in this law, and what about the girl that identifies with being a male and goes into the men's bathroom and ends up getting raped,  can she cry rape. some laws are crazy

There's nothing compassionate about forcing everyone - at the barrel of the fun of withheld federal funds - to make their all-too-real, anatomical girls to either stifle well-founded discomfort with sharing intimate spaces with anatomical males or else forfeit education. They will have to lie back and take it. This from a left that touts how many girls and young women are survivors of sexual assault. Make no mistake, this is also the end of girls' schools, girls' sports and Title IX.
The schools that will most suffer are already the ones underfunded and couldn't get any attention from the feds wrt to aid. But who cares about that, let's signal what good people we are on the backs of the truly vulnerable, non-voting little girls who already have enough to deal with.
A shameful display of arrogant, misogynistic power.
Perhaps that's because the bathrooms aren't open to men in the first place? And your suggestion is to fix that by making the bathrooms yet another place where women and girls are easy prey?

My suspicion is that this is another attempt to undermine women's rights by dismantling that last safe place left for women: the public bathroom, strictly unavailable to men through generations by this Puritan country. And I have liked it that way and it's the reason why I prefer to live in this country. Again, I'm not concerned about transgender individuals. I'm concerned about the allowance subject to the abuse I have witnessed increasingly in European countries.

You are right--I am comparing the Jim Crow laws, which targeted an innocuous minority at the behest of an intolerant majority, to my state's HB2, which targets an innocuous minority at the behest of an intolerant majority. I'm afraid I just don't see the relevance of proportion, since that should not determine the degree of respect, dignity, or freedom from persecution that a person should be entitled. Give Lorretta Lynch's remarks another read, and you'll see I'm not the first to invoke Brown v. Board of Education. The Civil Rights Act (specifically Title VII) is the entire basis of the DoJ's letter to McCrory.

I disagree with the North Carolina law, but I disagree more with the federal government telling local school districts what policies they must follow.  The Obama administration can and should promulgate whatever policies they see as desirable in all federal government offices and for all federal government contractors.  But they have no authority over local school districts, and pushing liberal change where it is unwelcome will create resentment.  Expect a lot of parents to take their children out of public schools.  Expect conservative candidates to fare better in November.

Would be interesting to do a story on the threat of withholding federal funds from Texas and Virginia over transgender bathroom rights vs. the lack of talk of withholding funds from Saudi Arabia, which has no law against rape, and Afghanistan, where rape victims are often executed (for being victims), not to mention the legislated degrading treatment of women in each country - all enabled by US tax dollars.

Seems a little inconsistent to me.

While I am supportive of transgender persons why is this a key issue for President Obama at the end of his terms. As I have read here the President has the ability to have the IRS change regulation to do away with carried interest. There seems to be strong agreement that this would be a move supported by most Americans and have a real impact on our deficits. Perhaps the Democratic powers to be would not support this move.
To protect our daughter, we have to enter the lady's bathroom everytime with her and wait right outside the cubicle other than the bathroom entrance as before, I mean as a father.
I am a liberal. Progressive. And democrat. I fear a move such as this could cost the Democratic party the election. This should have been handled by the courts.

This Wednesday, a male member of our bird watching group returned to our table at the Boat House in Central Park announcing that he had just used the ladies room.  Said he disliked "peeing against a wall (urinal?)" and preferred to sit down.  He was physically male and dressed as such.  He apparently feels entitled to use whichever facilities he prefers.  Opinions?

@Richard: I'm afraid you're now losing your personal credibility even more quickly than are those "Never Trump!" politicos who've already embraced him. First off, the Clinton Foundation has actually done a lot of good work in the developing world, regardless of whatever ulterior motives its founders may have been harboring. Second, if it were the Clintons who were declining to release their tax returns you KNOW you'd be joining The Donald and every other member of your Party in their inevitable (and completely justified) denunciations. And then, of course, there's the little matter of that Kenyan birth certificate that Mr. Trump claims to have access to but has never bothered to produce (libel laws, anyone?). Speaking of libel, I'd be very careful about unproven accusations of rape launched against...anyone.
But, most importantly, whatever gives you the impression that the most divisive figure in American public life can get DC's liberals and conservatives to come together to do what's right for the great unwashed that he loathes and ridicules? A man who reverses his policy proposals before he can even complete a sentence can hardly be relied upon to convince other people to drop their ideological horsebleep and do something commonsensical. Never mind Hillary or Bernie; I'd sooner pledge my soul to Lucifer. At least his agenda has been carefully thought out.
Tough! But fair. I enjoyed wrestling with it...some great clues, especially those for cell mate and repo.

You must have missed it when Sanders released his 2014 form 1040 some time ago and just recently the entire 2014 return.  Showing his predictably huge income of, I recall, about $250,000, most of it salary.

I was just thinking the reverse: a transgenerderized female who has a M on her birth certificate is now supposed to walk into a male bathroom-- there will be guys in there who will rape her, maybe even kill her.  It will result in violence-- let people go into the bathroom were they will be fitting in and let them empty their bladder-- everybody knows how uncomfertable it is not to find a bathroom when needed-- best solution have a single bathroom for everybody like you have in any home and save on plumbing- done in many establishments. The right wing is inventing a problem were there is none and they want to keep this going to distract from the real election for a real US President who is as skilled and compassionate and diplomatic as the current one.

Why all the confusion about gender identify?  You are either of the  physical gender you were born with or you are of the opposite gender that you mentally belong to.  As a practical matter, one is of the gender that he or she mentally chooses  regardless of physical gender.  The real question that needs answering is: Should one dress for one's mental gender or for one's physical gender?  And the answer would seem to be: Dress for one's mental gender; it would seem to be much more consistent with reality.
Eliminating the legal category of biological woman is a pretty major attack on women. Stop insisting women always need to be kind to men who are bullying them.
